hw2

Class DotsGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • hw2.DotsGame

  • public class DotsGame
extends java.lang.Object
    This class encapsulates the game logic for a video game called Dots. The game consists of a 2D array or grid of colored icons, called dots, along with an ordered list that we will call the selection list. Intuitively, the selection list represents a set of adjacent dots, all of the same color, that have been selected by the player. When selection is complete (e.g. the mouse is released), the selected dots disappear from the grid, and the dots above shift down to take their places. Then new dots fill in each column from the top. A point is scored for each dot that disappears from the grid. There is a special rule for the case that the selected dots form a loop; then all dots in the grid of the same color disappear too.

        public DotsGame(int width,

        Parameters:
        width - number of columns
        height - number of rows
        generator - generator for new icons

      • DotsGame

        public DotsGame(java.lang.String[] data,
                Generator generator)
        Constructs a game based on the given string array according to the conventions of Util.createGridFromString. The given Generator instance is used to create new dpts.
        Parameters:
        data - string indicating initial configuration of grid
        generator - generator for new icons

      • select

        public void select(int row,
                   int col)
        Attempts to select the dot at given position. A descriptor for the dot is added to the selection list provided that a) the given position is adjacent to the last one added to the selection list, and b) its type matches the type of those already in the selection list, and c) the given position is not already in the selection list OR it completes a loop. Completing a loop means that the given position matches the first one in the selection list, the list has length at least 3, and the given position does not already occur twice in the list.
        Parameters:
        row - row of the dot to be selected
        col - column of the dot to be selected

      • getSelectionList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Descriptor> getSelectionList()
        Returns a list of descriptors for currently selected dots.
        Returns:
        the selection list

      • release

        public java.util.ArrayList<Descriptor> release()
        If the selection list has at least two elements, replaces all selected positions with null, clears the selection list, and updates the score. If the selection list does not contain at least two elements, no positions are nulled but the selection list is still cleared. If the selection list includes a completed loop, then all dots of matching type are also nulled and the score is updated accordingly. The method returns a list containing all nulled positions. (The list is in no particular order but should not contain duplicates.)
        Returns:
        list of descriptors for cells that are nulled as a result of this operation

      • collapseColumn

        public java.util.ArrayList<Descriptor> collapseColumn(int col)
        Collapses the dots in the given column of the current game grid such that all null dots, if any, are at the top of the column and non-null dots are shifted toward the bottom (i.e., as if by gravity). The returned list contains Descriptors representing dots that were moved (if any) with their new row and column; moreover, each Descriptor's getPreviousRow method returns the original row of the dot. The returned list is in no particular order.
        Parameters:
        col - column to be collapsed
        Returns:
        list of descriptors for moved dots

      • fillColumn

        public java.util.ArrayList<Descriptor> fillColumn(int col)
        Fills the null grid positions (if any) at the top of the given column in the current game grid. The returned list contains Descriptors representing new dots added to the column with their new row and column. The previous row for all descriptors is set to -1. The new dots are produced by the generator's generate method. The list is in no particular order.
        Parameters:
        col - column to be filled
        Returns:
        list of new descriptors for dots added to the column
